Here I could win both White's pawns, but after 55. ... Nxd4+; 56. Kxf4, Nxb5; 57. Nc4 and there is nothing to be done to save the pawn on b6. Knights are notoriously bad at stopping passed Rook's pawns, but I don't have enough theory to know if K + N + hP beats K + N, and I suspected it probably didn't.
